metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5339 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Check_MK before 1.2.4p4 and 1.2.5 before 1.2.5i4 allows remote authenticated users to write check_mk config files (.mk files) to arbitrary locations via vectors related to row selections.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

check-mk-agent - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-agent-logwatch - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-config-icinga - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-livestatus - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-multisite - 1.2.6p12-1
check-mk-server - 1.2.6p12-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: check-mk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.6p12-1').
